qas.question: Air attacks headed by  Germany increased in 1915 in what area?
Who was tasked with the job to make improvements to the AA as a result of the German attacks?

answers.text: Royal Navy gunnery expert, Admiral Sir Percy Scott

qas.question: What was used because of night attacks?
How many AA Sections were defending Britain by December 1916?
How many AA Sections were with the BEF in France during the same time?

context: German air attacks on <a0_0>the British Isles<a0_0/> increased in 1915 and the AA efforts were deemed somewhat ineffective, so a <a1_0>Royal Navy gunnery expert, Admiral Sir Percy Scott<a1_0/>, was appointed to make improvements, particularly an integrated AA defence for London. The air defences were expanded with more RNVR AA guns, 75 mm and 3-inch, the pom-poms being ineffective. The naval 3-inch was also adopted by the army, the QF 3 inch 20 cwt (76 mm), a new field mounting was introduced in 1916. Since most attacks were at night, <a2_0>searchlights<a2_0/> were soon used, and acoustic methods of detection and locating were developed. By December 1916 there were <a3_0>183<a3_0/> AA Sections defending Britain (most with the 3-inch), <a4_0>74<a4_0/> with the BEF in France and 10 in the Middle East.
